author: TNN
title: Environment Day: Environment Day celebrated at Government Pre-University Girls’ College in Mangaluru | Mangaluru News - Times of India
text: Mangaluru: The Government Pre-University Girls’ College, in collaboration with Saalu Marada Thimmakka Environmental Association and NSS, jointly celebrated Environment Day and Vanamahotsava. On this occasion, fruit saplings were planted in the college premises. It was presided over by college principal Vanita Devadiga. The chief guest, Keshava Ramakunja, founder of Mangalore’s environmental awareness organisation ‘Kasvi Hasiru Dibbana,’ participated and encouraged students to plant a tree on their birthdays, to contribute to environmental conservation. tnnWe also published the following articles recentlyA host of factors, both social & environmental, behind rising cases of mobocracy: ExpertsDiscover the sociological insights behind recent cases of mob violence in Kolkata. Experts discuss factors like repressed anger, voyeuristic tendencies, and the impact of global warming on violent behavior. Learn more about the need to address underlying societal issues to prevent such incidents.111442848Priyotoma fame Idhika Paul celebrates her birthday by planting saplings; Gives away a special messageLearn about actress Idhika Paul's unique birthday celebration where she planted saplings in the countryside. Known for her roles in Rimli and Pilu, she is set to make her Tollywood debut in the film Khadaan alongside superstar Dev.
